{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Hotel Manager",
  "description": "Bonzee Consulting is a forward-thinking and people-oriented HR/Business Advisory company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Oversee the day-to-day operations of the hotel, including Front Office, Housekeeping, Food &amp; Beverage, and Guest Relations.
	Ensure exceptional guest service delivery in line with the hotel&rsquo;s brand standards.
	Develop and manage budgets, monitor financial performance, and implement cost-control measures.
	Lead, train, and motivate hotel staff to achieve performance and service goals.
	Handle guest complaints promptly and professionally to ensure guest satisfaction.
	Coordinate procurement and vendor management to maintain quality and efficiency.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop promotions and strategies to boost occupancy.
	Prepare and present regular reports on hotel performance to senior management.
	Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and regulatory standards.
	Maintain the property&rsquo;s ambience and uphold the distinct character of the boutique brand.
	Lead, supervise, and motivate hotel staff to achieve performance targets.
	Identify training and development needs to enhance employee skills and service quality.
	Conduct performance appraisals and enforce disciplinary measures where necessary.
	Promote a positive, professional, and collaborative work environment.
	Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
	Oversee safety, hygiene, and sanitation procedures across all departments.
	Address guest complaints promptly and implement corrective actions where required.
	Monitor and improve guest feedback and satisfaction scores.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Contact@bonzeeconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-31",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-06",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Bonzee Consulting"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

}



Hotel Manager Job at Bonzee Consulting




        
    

        
        Bonzee Consulting is a forward-thinking and people-oriented HR/Business Advisory company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Manager
Job Location: Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee the day-to-day operations of the hotel, including Front Office, Housekeeping, Food & Beverage, and Guest Relations.
	Ensure exceptional guest service delivery in line with the hotel’s brand standards.
	Develop and manage budgets, monitor financial performance, and implement cost-control measures.
	Lead, train, and motivate hotel staff to achieve performance and service goals.
	Handle guest complaints promptly and professionally to ensure guest satisfaction.
	Coordinate procurement and vendor management to maintain quality and efficiency.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to develop promotions and strategies to boost occupancy.
	Prepare and present regular reports on hotel performance to senior management.
	Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and regulatory standards.
	Maintain the property’s ambience and uphold the distinct character of the boutique brand.
	Lead, supervise, and motivate hotel staff to achieve performance targets.
	Identify training and development needs to enhance employee skills and service quality.
	Conduct performance appraisals and enforce disciplinary measures where necessary.
	Promote a positive, professional, and collaborative work environment.
	Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
	Oversee safety, hygiene, and sanitation procedures across all departments.
	Address guest complaints promptly and implement corrective actions where required.
	Monitor and improve guest feedback and satisfaction scores.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 per month. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Contact@bonzeeconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Assurance Engineer",
  "description": "Cavista is a global technology company creating cloud-based software solutions for clients. With operations around the world, we globalize, standardize and localize our processes, while at the same time remaining sensitive to specific needs in different regions. Our mission is to empower organizations with the world&rsquo;s best technology solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Quality Assurance Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju,&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description&nbsp;


	Collaborate with Product Owners to review and analyze business and functional requirements and design documents for sound testing strategies.&nbsp;
	Responsible for testing of a product, including writing the test plans and test cases, writing automation scripts, and testing the complete application from the UI through to the backend.&nbsp;
	Perform detailed cross-browser/cross-device testing, browser-based testing, mobile testing.&nbsp;
	Maintain requirements traceability with test case coverage.&nbsp;
	Provide expertise in understanding what to test, as well as how it should be tested.&nbsp;
	Implement test methodology best practices as defined by departmental standards.&nbsp;
	Advocate for testing standards&nbsp;
	Must maintain strong relationships with internal customers.&nbsp;
	Facilitate testing meetings, summarize results, issue/defect reporting, maintain metrics and provide go/no go recommendation.&nbsp;
	Review software and production issues as they occur for a holistic analysis of the impacts and possible causes.&nbsp;
	Create, execute, and document test plans and test cases (UAT, Integration, End-to-End, Regression, Beta), ensuring functional coverage and application performance.&nbsp;


Qualifications


	5+ years as a professional Quality Assurance Analyst testing (8+ years if no University degree) applications with high volume and high-reliability requirements&nbsp;
	Ability to work effectively with little supervision and strong attention to detail in a team environment.&nbsp;
	Aptitude for learning new technologies; supported by solid problem solving and troubleshooting skills.&nbsp;
	Ability to work well with a variety of people with varying technical skill sets.&nbsp;
	Ability to leverage experience to deliver reliable and repeatable tests.&nbsp;
	Broad understanding of quality engineering principles and test methodologies&nbsp;
	Ability to contribute to a vision of future state of testing by troubleshooting hardware and software issues.&nbsp;
	Basic SQL, Unix/Linux skills&nbsp;
	Experience in manual testing, automation testing experience is a plus.&nbsp;
	Excellent communication skills (written, verbal and listening)&nbsp;
	5-year experience in functional, integration or system testing web-based applications desired&nbsp;
	Experience executing test plans and scripts and verifying expected results.&nbsp;
	Strong understanding of common software development life cycles (waterfall, iterative, agile) and contemporary software quality assurance processes and automated tools&nbsp;


Additional Information:


	5 - day workweek.
	Flextime.
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development
	Remote working and IT Assets provided for Remote employees
	Mentoring and Counseling
	Referral Bonus
	Work from Anywhere - Flexibility that allows you to work where you are most comfortable, whether at home, at work, or a combination of both.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-31",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Cavista"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189664"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Quality Assurance Engineer Job at Cavista




        
    

        
        Cavista is a global technology company creating cloud-based software solutions for clients. With operations around the world, we globalize, standardize and localize our processes, while at the same time remaining sensitive to specific needs in different regions. Our mission is to empower organizations with the world’s best technology solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Engineer

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos

Job Description 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Collaborate with Product Owners to review and analyze business and functional requirements and design documents for sound testing strategies. 
	Responsible for testing of a product, including writing the test plans and test cases, writing automation scripts, and testing the complete application from the UI through to the backend. 
	Perform detailed cross-browser/cross-device testing, browser-based testing, mobile testing. 
	Maintain requirements traceability with test case coverage. 
	Provide expertise in understanding what to test, as well as how it should be tested. 
	Implement test methodology best practices as defined by departmental standards. 
	Advocate for testing standards 
	Must maintain strong relationships with internal customers. 
	Facilitate testing meetings, summarize results, issue/defect reporting, maintain metrics and provide go/no go recommendation. 
	Review software and production issues as they occur for a holistic analysis of the impacts and possible causes. 
	Create, execute, and document test plans and test cases (UAT, Integration, End-to-End, Regression, Beta), ensuring functional coverage and application performance. 


Qualifications


	5+ years as a professional Quality Assurance Analyst testing (8+ years if no University degree) applications with high volume and high-reliability requirements 
	Ability to work effectively with little supervision and strong attention to detail in a team environment. 
	Aptitude for learning new technologies; supported by solid problem solving and troubleshooting skills. 
	Ability to work well with a variety of people with varying technical skill sets. 
	Ability to leverage experience to deliver reliable and repeatable tests. 
	Broad understanding of quality engineering principles and test methodologies 
	Ability to contribute to a vision of future state of testing by troubleshooting hardware and software issues. 
	Basic SQL, Unix/Linux skills 
	Experience in manual testing, automation testing experience is a plus. 
	Excellent communication skills (written, verbal and listening) 
	5-year experience in functional, integration or system testing web-based applications desired 
	Experience executing test plans and scripts and verifying expected results. 
	Strong understanding of common software development life cycles (waterfall, iterative, agile) and contemporary software quality assurance processes and automated tools 


Additional Information:


	5 - day workweek.
	Flextime.
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development
	Remote working and IT Assets provided for Remote employees
	Mentoring and Counseling
	Referral Bonus
	Work from Anywhere - Flexibility that allows you to work where you are most comfortable, whether at home, at work, or a combination of both.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "description": "Jibs-Ray Nigeria Limited is a recruitment and consulting company established in 2018 to proffer manpower solutions to its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	DevOps Engineer to manage, automate, and optimize our cloud infrastructure and CI/CD workflows. The candidate has a strong background in cloud environments, container orchestration, and infrastructure-as-code, ensuring high system availability and performance across multiple production environments.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, deploy, and manage CI/CD pipelines for development and production environments.
	Build and maintain scalable infrastructure using Terraform, Ansible, or similar IaC tools.
	Manage containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes (K8s).
	Monitor system performance, logs, and uptime using tools like Grafana, Prometheus, and ELK.
	Ensure infrastructure and deployments meet security and compliance standards.
	Collaborate with developers to streamline the software release process.
	Optimize cost, reliability, and performance of cloud resources.
	Implement disaster recovery, backup strategies, and automation scripts.


Requirements


	5+ years of experience as a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer.
	Proficiency in Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
	Hands-on experience with Terraform, Ansible, or other IaC frameworks.
	Strong knowledge of Linux administration and shell scripting (Bash, Python, or Go).
	Familiarity with AWS, GCP, or DigitalOcean.
	Knowledge of networking, load balancing, and cloud security best practices.
	Ability to troubleshoot and optimize production workloads.


Preferred:


	Experience with monitoring and alerting (Grafana, Prometheus, Loki).
	Exposure to zero-downtime deployments and blue-green or canary releases.
	Familiarity with GitOps practices.


Method of Application&nbsp;

DevOps Engineer Job at Jibs-Ray Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Jibs-Ray Nigeria Limited is a recruitment and consulting company established in 2018 to proffer manpower solutions to its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	DevOps Engineer to manage, automate, and optimize our cloud infrastructure and CI/CD workflows. The candidate has a strong background in cloud environments, container orchestration, and infrastructure-as-code, ensuring high system availability and performance across multiple production environments.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design, deploy, and manage CI/CD pipelines for development and production environments.
	Build and maintain scalable infrastructure using Terraform, Ansible, or similar IaC tools.
	Manage containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes (K8s).
	Monitor system performance, logs, and uptime using tools like Grafana, Prometheus, and ELK.
	Ensure infrastructure and deployments meet security and compliance standards.
	Collaborate with developers to streamline the software release process.
	Optimize cost, reliability, and performance of cloud resources.
	Implement disaster recovery, backup strategies, and automation scripts.


Requirements


	5+ years of experience as a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer.
	Proficiency in Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
	Hands-on experience with Terraform, Ansible, or other IaC frameworks.
	Strong knowledge of Linux administration and shell scripting (Bash, Python, or Go).
	Familiarity with AWS, GCP, or DigitalOcean.
	Knowledge of networking, load balancing, and cloud security best practices.
	Ability to troubleshoot and optimize production workloads.


Preferred:


	Experience with monitoring and alerting (Grafana, Prometheus, Loki).
	Exposure to zero-downtime deployments and blue-green or canary releases.
	Familiarity with GitOps practices.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: jibs.ray@gmail.com cc: ibohjp@ebsafr.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Software Engineer",
  "description": "Estuary Business Solutions (EBS) Limited is a Nigerian-based business consulting and technology services company with experience and comprehensive capabilities across diverse business functions. EBS collaborates with clients to support their strategic objectives of transformation into high-performance businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Software Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description


	Senior Software Engineer with strong expertise in Java or Go (Golang) and modern backend technologies.
	The ideal candidate will design, build, and maintain scalable, secure, and high-performance backend systems that power our digital platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop backend systems, microservices, and APIs using Java (Spring Boot) or Go.
	Architect, implement, and maintain database schemas (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or Redis).
	Integrate external APIs and third-party services securely and efficiently.
	Implement CI/CD, automated testing, and code review processes.
	Collaborate with DevOps to optimize deployments, monitoring, and scaling.
	Participate in technical design sessions and contribute to architectural decisions.
	Ensure systems meet high standards of performance, reliability, and security.
	Mentor junior developers and promote best coding practices.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree
	5+ years of professional software development experience.
	Strong proficiency in Java (Spring Boot) or Go (Golang).
	Solid understanding of microservices architecture and RESTful API design.
	Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
	Good knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.
	Familiarity with Git, unit testing frameworks, and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or DigitalOcean).
	Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.
	Strong communication and team collaboration abilities.


Preferred:


	Experience with message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, NATS).
	Familiarity with event-driven architectures.
	Knowledge of system security, API gateway design, and observability (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK)


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Applications and CV to:&nbsp;funkea@ebsafr.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Senior Software Engineer Job at Estuary Business Solutions (EBS) Limited




        
    

        
        Estuary Business Solutions (EBS) Limited is a Nigerian-based business consulting and technology services company with experience and comprehensive capabilities across diverse business functions. EBS collaborates with clients to support their strategic objectives of transformation into high-performance businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Software Engineer

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Senior Software Engineer with strong expertise in Java or Go (Golang) and modern backend technologies.
	The ideal candidate will design, build, and maintain scalable, secure, and high-performance backend systems that power our digital platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and develop backend systems, microservices, and APIs using Java (Spring Boot) or Go.
	Architect, implement, and maintain database schemas (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or Redis).
	Integrate external APIs and third-party services securely and efficiently.
	Implement CI/CD, automated testing, and code review processes.
	Collaborate with DevOps to optimize deployments, monitoring, and scaling.
	Participate in technical design sessions and contribute to architectural decisions.
	Ensure systems meet high standards of performance, reliability, and security.
	Mentor junior developers and promote best coding practices.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	5+ years of professional software development experience.
	Strong proficiency in Java (Spring Boot) or Go (Golang).
	Solid understanding of microservices architecture and RESTful API design.
	Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
	Good knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases.
	Familiarity with Git, unit testing frameworks, and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or DigitalOcean).
	Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.
	Strong communication and team collaboration abilities.


Preferred:


	Experience with message queues (Kafka, RabbitMQ, NATS).
	Familiarity with event-driven architectures.
	Knowledge of system security, API gateway design, and observability (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK)


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Applications and CV to: funkea@ebsafr.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Sproxil
content:
Sproxil is a global brand protection & consumer engagement solutions provider specialized in the provision of cutting edge advanced technology to combat counterfeiting, product theft and adulterations; as well as providing a platform for consumer engagement.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Call Center Associate

Job Location: Lagos
Position Type: Full Time

About the job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a motivated and customer-focused Call Center Associate to join our team on a 3-month contract.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for handling inbound and outbound calls, responding to customer inquiries, resolving issues efficiently, and ensuring a positive customer experience.
	This role requires excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle inbound and outbound calls in a professional and courteous manner.
	Respond promptly to customer inquiries and provide accurate information.
	Document all customer interactions and feedback in the CRM system.
	Escalate complex issues to the appropriate team or supervisor when necessary.
	Follow up with customers to ensure satisfactory resolution of issues.
	Support campaigns or projects that require customer engagement or feedback collection.
	Maintain confidentiality of customer data and adhere to company policies.
	Achieve performance metrics such as call handling time, quality, and customer satisfaction.


Requirements


	Minimum of an O'level, OND or Bachelor’s degree in any discipline
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong listening, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a structured environment with minimal supervision.
	Basic computer literacy (MS Office, CRM tools, or related systems).
	Previous experience in a customer service or call center role is an advantage but not mandatory.
	Positive attitude, professionalism, and a commitment to excellent service delivery.


Compensation
Competitive and commensurate with experience.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Java Developer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Position Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Mid-Level Java Developer with solid experience in Spring Boot and legacy Java technologies such as JSP and Servlets.
	The successful candidate will work on developing new features, maintaining existing systems, and supporting the transition from legacy applications to modern Java frameworks.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, test, and deploy scalable Java applications using Spring Boot and related frameworks.
	Maintain and enhance existing JSP/Servlet-based applications.
	Participate in the design, development, and integration of APIs and backend services.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams including front-end developers, QA, and DevOps.
	Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices.
	Perform code reviews, identify performance bottlenecks, and optimize existing solutions.
	Support the migration and modernization of legacy systems.


Requirements
Required Skills and Qualifications:


	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	3–6 years of hands-on Java development experience.
	Strong proficiency in Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Data JPA, and REST APIs.
	Working knowledge of JSP, Servlets, JDBC, and older Java EE technologies.
	Good understanding of OOP principles, design patterns, and exception handling.
	Experience with SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle).
	Familiarity with Git, Maven/Gradle, and unit testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito).
	Strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills.


Benefits


	Competitive pay
	Agile work environment
	Work life balance


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) 3D CAD Designer

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly skilled 3D CAD Designer with extensive experience in designing mechanical casings and assemblies for electronic devices.
	The ideal candidate will be proficient in SolidWorks or Fusion 360 or TinkerCad, capable of creating precise, functional, and manufacture designs optimized for 3D printing, injection molding, or other fabrication methods.
	The contractor will work closely with our product and engineering teams to transform concepts and electronic schematics into production-ready enclosures that meet technical, aesthetic, and usability requirements.


Key Responsibilities


	Design, model, and optimize 3D mechanical casings for electronic devices, including housings, snap-fits, and mounting features.
	Develop assemblies ensuring proper fit for PCBs, batteries, connectors, and other components.
	Prepare 3D-print-ready files (STL/OBJ/3MF) and support structures for prototyping.
	Collaborate with engineers to ensure clearance, tolerance, and accessibility for components.
	Conduct design reviews and iterate quickly based on feedback.
	Ensure designs adhere to manufacturing constraints, including 3D printing,injection or molding.
	Maintain organized libraries of CAD files, version history, and documentation.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	5+ years of professional experience in mechanical CAD design for consumer electronics, IoT devices, or similar products.
	Expert proficiency in SolidWorks and/or Fusion 360 (parametric design, assemblies, sheet metal, surface modeling).
	Proven experience designing electronic device casings, including enclosures for PCBs, connectors, and batteries.
	Strong understanding of 3D printing processes, tolerances, and materials (PLA, ABS, resin, PETG, etc.).
	Experience with design for manufacturing (DFM) principles.
	Familiarity with file export for 3D printing (STL/OBJ/3MF), mesh repair, and slicer workflow.
	Excellent attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and ability to work independently.
	Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Benefits


	Competitive contract rate, commensurate with experience and scope of work.


Click here to apply online    

    

        Click here to Apply
